scenarios.scenario: Drivers receive real-time manifest updates within 5 seconds of changes.
scenarios.stimulus: Route changes are made in the backend system.
scenarios.response: Drivers' applications update their manifests instantly.
scenarios.response_measure: Response time is monitored to ensure updates occur within 5 seconds.

scenarios.scenario: The application allows drivers to access live updates without requiring a manual refresh.
scenarios.stimulus: Drivers start their application while on the route.
scenarios.response: The application displays the latest manifest automatically.
scenarios.response_measure: 95% of drivers report receiving updates without manual refresh.

scenarios.scenario: The system can handle 1000 simultaneous connections for real-time updates.
scenarios.stimulus: Drivers log in to the application during morning rush hours.
scenarios.response: All drivers remain connected and receive updates without interruptions.
scenarios.response_measure: Uptime is monitored to ensure availability above 99.9%.

scenarios.scenario: The system scales to support real-time updates as the number of drivers increases.
scenarios.stimulus: Additional drivers are deployed during peak season.
scenarios.response: The system continues to provide real-time updates without any degradation in performance.
scenarios.response_measure: System performance is monitored during peak load times.

decisions.decision: Implement WebSocket for real-time manifest updates.
decisions.context: The existing system method is a periodic fetch, leading to delays in manifest updates.
decisions.trade_off: Improves real-time response but increases complexity in handling message states.

failure_modes.mitigation: Implement reconnection strategies and fallback to polling.

failure_modes.description: Latency spikes due to increased message traffic.
failure_modes.mitigation: Monitor performance and optimize message handling logic.

decisions.decision: Utilize push notifications for offline support to keep drivers updated.
decisions.context: Drivers may encounter areas with no internet, yet need updates.
decisions.trade_off: Ensures updates during downtime but adds complexity in managing message states.
alternatives_considered: Offline data storage without push notifications

failure_modes.description: Push notifications fail to be sent when drivers regain connectivity.
failure_modes.mitigation: Queue notifications during offline periods and dispatch on reconnect.

trade_off_analysis.recommendation: Adopt WebSocket implementation because it maximizes responsiveness and user satisfaction while still being scalable.
